intro: Lepidagathis attenuata, commonly known as the slender lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Lepidagathis attenuata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
